profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on December 30, 2011

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Record books, None; Probate files, circa 1834-1975.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Madison, New Haven County, Town established in May 1826, Parent Town: Guilford

The Madison Probate District was constituted May 22, 1834, from the Guilford Probate District. The Madison Probate District merged with the Guilford Probate District on January 5, 2011 to create the Madison - Guilford Probate District which serves the municipalities of Guilford and Madison.
Town of Madison, Probate District chronology:

May 1826 - May 21, 1834, Guilford District
May 22, 1834 - January 4, 2011, Madison District
January 5, 2011 - Present, Madison - Guilford District
For Probate Court contact information and hours of operation see, .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Probate record books, None. Contact the probate court to access original record books. See Alternative Form Available note below.
Probate files, circa 1834-1975. Probate files may consist of estates, conservatorships, guardianships, commitments, and insolvencies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Probate files in accession 2011-043 are arranged as received from the probate court.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aid
otherfindaid.p: Record Books: Index cards for the record books have been scanned. Ask History and Genealogy staff for assistance. Note: CSL does not hold any original record books. See Alternate Form Available section for volumes available on microfilm.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: See Alternate Form Available Section below.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Record books, volumes 1-2, 4-6, 8-9, 13, 1834-1917, were microfilmed by the Genealogical Society of Utah and are available for use in the History and Genealogy reading room or through the .

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The probate files in accession 2011-043 were transferred to the Connecticut State Library on November 9, 2010.
